title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\Instance
name: Instance
description:
Represents an Instance resource.

An instance is a virtual machine that is hosted on Google Cloud Platform. For more information, read Virtual Machine Instances. (== resource_for {$api_version}.instances ==)

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.Instance

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.can_ip_forward
params.description: Allows this instance to send and receive packets with non-matching destination or source IPs. This is required if you plan to use this instance to forward routes. For more information, see Enabling IP Forwarding.

params.name: data.cpu_platform
params.description: [Output Only] The CPU platform used by this instance.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.deletion_protection
params.description: Whether the resource should be protected against deletion.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

params.name: data.disks
params.description: Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.

params.name: data.display_device
params.description: Enables display device for the instance.

params.name: data.fingerprint
params.description: Specifies a fingerprint for this resource, which is essentially a hash of the instance's contents and used for optimistic locking. The fingerprint is initially generated by Compute Engine and changes after every request to modify or update the instance. You must always provide an up-to-date fingerprint hash in order to update the instance. To see the latest fingerprint, make get() request to the instance.

params.name: data.guest_accelerators
params.description: A list of the type and count of accelerator cards attached to the instance.

params.name: data.hostname
params.description: Specifies the hostname of the instance. The specified hostname must be RFC1035 compliant. If hostname is not specified, the default hostname is [INSTANCE_NAME].c.[PROJECT_ID].internal when using the global DNS, and [INSTANCE_NAME].[ZONE].c.[PROJECT_ID].internal when using zonal DNS.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] The unique identifier for the resource. This identifier is defined by the server.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output Only] Type of the resource. Always compute#instance for instances.

params.name: data.label_fingerprint
params.description: A fingerprint for this request, which is essentially a hash of the label's contents and used for optimistic locking. The fingerprint is initially generated by Compute Engine and changes after every request to modify or update labels. You must always provide an up-to-date fingerprint hash in order to update or change labels. To see the latest fingerprint, make get() request to the instance.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Labels to apply to this instance. These can be later modified by the setLabels method.

params.name: data.last_start_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Last start timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.last_stop_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Last stop timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.last_suspended_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Last suspended timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.machine_type
params.description: Full or partial URL of the machine type resource to use for this instance, in the format: zones/zone/machineTypes/machine-type. This is provided by the client when the instance is created. For example, the following is a valid partial url to a predefined machine type: zones/us-central1-f/machineTypes/n1-standard-1 To create a custom machine type, provide a URL to a machine type in the following format, where CPUS is 1 or an even number up to 32 (2, 4, 6, ... 24, etc), and MEMORY is the total memory for this instance. Memory must be a multiple of 256 MB and must be supplied in MB (e.g. 5 GB of memory is 5120 MB): zones/zone/machineTypes/custom-CPUS-MEMORY For example: zones/us-central1-f/machineTypes/custom-4-5120 For a full list of restrictions, read the Specifications for custom machine types.

params.name: data.metadata
params.description: The metadata key/value pairs assigned to this instance. This includes custom metadata and predefined keys.

params.name: data.min_cpu_platform
params.description: Specifies a minimum CPU platform for the VM instance. Applicable values are the friendly names of CPU platforms, such as minCpuPlatform: "Intel Haswell" or minCpuPlatform: "Intel Sandy Bridge".

params.name: data.name
params.description: The name of the resource, provided by the client when initially creating the resource. The resource name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.name: data.network_interfaces
params.description: An array of network configurations for this instance. These specify how interfaces are configured to interact with other network services, such as connecting to the internet. Multiple interfaces are supported per instance.

params.name: data.private_ipv6_google_access
params.description: The private IPv6 google access type for the VM. If not specified, use INHERIT_FROM_SUBNETWORK as default.

params.name: data.reservation_affinity
params.description: Specifies the reservations that this instance can consume from.

params.name: data.resource_policies
params.description: Resource policies applied to this instance.

params.name: data.scheduling
params.description: Sets the scheduling options for this instance.

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] Server-defined URL for this resource.

params.name: data.service_accounts
params.description: A list of service accounts, with their specified scopes, authorized for this instance. Only one service account per VM instance is supported. Service accounts generate access tokens that can be accessed through the metadata server and used to authenticate applications on the instance. See Service Accounts for more information.

params.name: data.start_restricted
params.description: [Output Only] Whether a VM has been restricted for start because Compute Engine has detected suspicious activity.

params.name: data.status
params.description: [Output Only] The status of the instance. One of the following values: PROVISIONING, STAGING, RUNNING, STOPPING, SUSPENDING, SUSPENDED, REPAIRING, and TERMINATED. For more information about the status of the instance, see Instance life cycle.

params.name: data.status_message
params.description: [Output Only] An optional, human-readable explanation of the status.

params.name: data.tags
params.description: Tags to apply to this instance. Tags are used to identify valid sources or targets for network firewalls and are specified by the client during instance creation. The tags can be later modified by the setTags method. Each tag within the list must comply with RFC1035. Multiple tags can be specified via the 'tags.items' field.

params.name: data.zone
params.description: [Output Only] URL of the zone where the instance resides. You must specify this field as part of the HTTP request URL. It is not settable as a field in the request body.

methods.name: getFingerprint
methods.description:
Specifies a fingerprint for this resource, which is essentially a hash of the instance's contents and used for optimistic locking. The fingerprint is initially generated by Compute Engine and changes after every request to modify or update the instance. You must always provide an up-to-date fingerprint hash in order to update the instance.

To see the latest fingerprint, make get() request to the instance.

methods.name: getMachineType
methods.description:
Full or partial URL of the machine type resource to use for this instance, in the format: zones/zone/machineTypes/machine-type. This is provided by the client when the instance is created. For example, the following is a valid partial url to a predefined machine type: zones/us-central1-f/machineTypes/n1-standard-1 To create a custom machine type, provide a URL to a machine type in the following format, where CPUS is 1 or an even number up to 32 (2, 4, 6, .

.. 24, etc), and MEMORY is the total memory for this instance. Memory must be a multiple of 256 MB and must be supplied in MB (e.g. 5 GB of memory is 5120 MB): zones/zone/machineTypes/custom-CPUS-MEMORY For example: zones/us-central1-f/machineTypes/custom-4-5120 For a full list of restrictions, read the Specifications for custom machine types.

Generated from protobuf field string machine_type = 227711026;

methods.description:

.. 24, etc), and MEMORY is the total memory for this instance. Memory must be a multiple of 256 MB and must be supplied in MB (e.g. 5 GB of memory is 5120 MB): zones/zone/machineTypes/custom-CPUS-MEMORY For example: zones/us-central1-f/machineTypes/custom-4-5120 For a full list of restrictions, read the Specifications for custom machine types.

methods.description:
[Output Only] The status of the instance. One of the following values: PROVISIONING, STAGING, RUNNING, STOPPING, SUSPENDING, SUSPENDED, REPAIRING, and TERMINATED. For more information about the status of the instance, see Instance life cycle.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.compute.v1.Instance.Status status = 181260274;

params.name: var
params.description: [Output Only] The status of the instance. One of the following values: PROVISIONING, STAGING, RUNNING, STOPPING, SUSPENDING, SUSPENDED, REPAIRING, and TERMINATED. For more information about the status of the instance, see Instance life cycle.

[Output Only] An optional, human-readable explanation of the status.

methods.name: getTags
methods.description:
Tags to apply to this instance. Tags are used to identify valid sources or targets for network firewalls and are specified by the client during instance creation. The tags can be later modified by the setTags method. Each tag within the list must comply with RFC1035. Multiple tags can be specified via the 'tags.items' field.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.compute.v1.Tags tags = 3552281;

methods.name: getZone
methods.description:
[Output Only] URL of the zone where the instance resides. You must specify this field as part of the HTTP request URL. It is not settable as a field in the request body.

Generated from protobuf field string zone = 3744684;
